context: The myth of Police brutality and "too quick to violence" needs to end. Present ONE case of an innocent non-criminal subject to this.  Just ONE.

replies.context:
TRY READING TODAYS NEWS.  There are TWO of them.

Clear Creek, CO. >>  You find the other one.

Still babbling little girl? 
You people are the root of 68% of gun violence.  Let's educate the 13% on how to contribute to society instead of destroying it.
Police your own race instead of blaming everyone else.
She pretends to care about police when she posts her bogus stats about cops being shot in red states, but you can see what she really thinks of police.

What does "too quick" mean to you?   The Clear Creek video shows officers talking to the man for over an hour trying to get him to come out.  In the end he had a knife and made a move for one of the officers near his door.  I probably wouldn't have fired, but I wasn't there and didn't see or know what those officers did.
Thug armed with a knife lunged at an officer and was shot . . .  Boo-Hoo.  One less criminal threatening people.
'Today's news'...  Did that include the officer's statement..?  Just do what the nice police officer tells you to do, and you'll be able to do it again tomorrow...

context: The police could improve the public opinion of themselves, by getting rid of bad police officers.

All this money spent for high tech surveillance.

stand by the oath they have taken, do not have near the 
violent crimes as Democratic Counties or repeat offenders.

because supposedly we are destroying America and its democracy.
Funny how I feel freedom all around me in the red Counties,

I'm sure technology is nice, but you can't beat eye-to-eye conversations and hands-on policing...  Defund Democrats.!

How about no contact speeding tickets. A camera unit in the police car snaps a pic of the 
offenders license plate and also records the speed of the offending vehicle and the results
are sent to the court then to the driver's address for payment of the fine.

replies.context: Driver and car owner may not be the same. Who pays the ticket?
The car owner (never lend your car to anyone).  If it's your kid, you'd probably wind up paying anyway.

In Egypt the cops didn't stop you to give you a traffic ticket unless there was an accident involved.  They recorded your license plate and when you went to renew you annual registration, you got hit with any traffic fines that were due or they confiscated your license plates.  Simple and efficient!

They already have cameras on most toll bridges near where I live. That sounds kind of a similar concept. The biggest problem I see with that is that if somebody is driving dangerously, then knowing that they have a ticket might deter them from doing it on again on the way back home
